name: Coverlet
help: <c>Coverlet</c> is a cross platform code coverage library for .NET Core, with support for line, branch and method coverage.The <c>dotnet test</c> command is used to execute unit tests in a given project. Unit tests are console application projects that have dependencies on the unit test framework (for example, MSTest, NUnit, or xUnit) and the dotnet test runner for the unit testing framework. These are packaged as NuGet packages and are restored as ordinary dependencies for the project.

properties.name: Target
properties.help: Path to the test runner application.

properties.name: TargetArgs
properties.help: Arguments to be passed to the test runner.

properties.name: Output
properties.help: Output of the generated coverage report

properties.name: Format
properties.help: Format of the generated coverage report.Can be specified multiple times to output multiple formats in a single run.

properties.name: Threshold
properties.help: Exits with error if the coverage % is below value.

properties.name: ThresholdType
properties.help: Coverage type to apply the threshold to.

properties.name: Exclude
properties.help: Filter expressions to exclude specific modules and types.

properties.name: Include
properties.help: Filter expressions to include specific modules and types.

properties.name: ExcludeByFile
properties.help: Glob patterns specifying source files to exclude.

properties.name: MergeWith
properties.help: Path to existing coverage result to merge.

properties.name: Properties
properties.help:
Set or override the specified project-level properties, where name is the property name and value is the property value. Specify each property separately, or use a semicolon or comma to separate multiple properties, as the following example shows:

/property:WarningLevel=2;OutDir=bin\Debug
